isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - INSTALL - CAB AIR RIDE system for 9200i/9400i/9900i DAY CAB MODELS WITHOUT DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES before DECEMBER 2001

svcproc.title: CAB AIR RIDE system for 9200 i/9400 i/9900 i DAY CAB MODELS WITHOUT DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES before DECEMBER 2001

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 105 for Items in parentheses.

The cab air ride system for 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i day cab models without Detroit Diesel engines before December 2001 contains two air springs (bags) (Item 1), two shock absorbers (Items 2 and 3), and is controlled by the cab air ride valve assembly (Item 4). The air ride components are not interchangeable with different cab models.

The following components - nylon air lines (to air spring) (Item 5), elbow fittings (Items 6 and 7), tee fitting (Item 8), air springs (bags) (Item 1), cab air ride valve assembly (Item 4), shock absorbers (Items 2 and 3) and track bar rod (Item 9) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 4), air spring (bag) (Item 1) and shock absorbers (Items 2 and 3) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

svcprocinfo.para:
Periodically check tightness of all fasteners and air line fitting connections. Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for (Figure 105) for proper tightening of all fasteners and air line fitting connections.

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Ride Shock Absorber
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 105 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install shock absorber (Item 2) as follows.

step2.para: Position shock absorber (Item 2) with mounting tabs at the top of shock absorber under air suspension upper mounting plate (Item 13) and mounting tabs at the bottom of shock absorber on top of air suspension lower mounting plate (Item 16).

Install two hex head screw sems assemblies (Item 10) thru mounting tabs at the top of shock absorber (Item 2) into weld nuts on air suspension upper mounting plate (Item 13). Tighten hex head screw sems assemblies (Item 10) to 155 to 190 Lbf-in (17 to 21 N•m).

Install two hex head screw sems assemblies (Item 10) thru mounting tabs at the bottom of shock absorber (Item 2) into weld nuts on air suspension lower mounting plate (Item 16). Tighten hex head screw sems assemblies (Item 10) to 155 to 190 Lbf-in (17 to 21 N•m).

step1.para: Install shock absorber (Item 3) as follows.

step2.para: Position flat washer (Item 14) and spacer (Item 15) over bottom shaft of shock absorber (Item 3) and install shock absorber shaft with flat washer and spacer into mounting hole of air suspension lower mounting plate (Item 16).
Install two flat washers (Item 12) and hex flanged lock nut (Item 11) onto bottom shaft of shock absorber (Item 3). Tighten hex flanged lock nut (Item 11) to 10 to 15 Lbf-ft (14 to 20 N•m).
Position mounting tabs at the top of shock absorber (Item 3) under air suspension upper mounting plate (Item 13).

Install two hex head screw sems assemblies (Item 10) thru mounting tabs at the top of shock absorber (Item 3) into weld nuts on air suspension upper mounting plate (Item 13). Tighten hex head screw sems assemblies (Item 10) to 155 to 190 Lbf-in (17 to 21 N•m).

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Ride Air Springs (Bags)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 105 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Position bottom mounting studs of both air springs (bags) (Item 1) into mounting holes of air suspension lower mounting plate (Item 16).

Release jack placed between frame rail flange and back of cab floor frame (Figure 106) , lower cab, making sure top mounting studs of both air springs (bags) (Item 1) are positioned into mounting holes of air suspension upper mounting plate (Item 13).
Secure both air springs (bags) (Item 1) by installing the push-on rings (Item 17) over the top and bottom studs of each air spring (bag).

Push push to connect elbow fitting (Item 6) into bottom of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 1). Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push push to connect tee fitting (Item 8) into bottom of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 1). Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

If disconnected, push nylon air line (to air spring) (Item 5) from push to connect tee fitting (Item 8) at bottom of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 1) into push to connect elbow fitting (Item 6) at bottom of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 1). Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

If disconnected, push nylon air line (to air spring) (Item 5) from push to connect elbow fitting (Item 6) at bottom of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 1) into push to connect tee fitting (Item 8) at bottom of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 1). Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

If disconnected, push nylon air line (to air spring) (Item 5) from push to connect tee fitting (Item 8) at bottom of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 1) into push to connect elbow fitting (Item 7) at bottom of cab air ride valve assembly (Item 4). Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

If disconnected, push nylon air line (to air spring) (Item 5) from push to connect elbow fitting (Item 7) at bottom of cab air ride valve assembly (Item 4) into push to connect tee fitting (Item 8) at bottom of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 1). Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.
Build up air pressure and check for air spring operation. Also check for air leaks. Correct as necessary.
Close hood and latch it on both sides.

Check cab ride height between bottom of air suspension upper mounting plate to top of crossmember the air suspension lower mounting plate is mounted on. Cab air suspension ride height is 7 3/4 inches (196.9 mm) (Figure 168) . If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS,
CAB AIR RIDE SYSTEM FOR 9200 i /9400 i /9900 i DAY CAB MODELS WITHOUT DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES BEFORE DECEMBER 2001
.

svcsubproc.title: Install Track Bar Rod
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 105 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install track bar rod (Item 9) as follows.

step2.para: Position track bar rod (Item 9) into track bar mount bracket (Item 18) and install hex flanged head bolt (Item 19) from the rear and install hex flanged lock nut (Item 20). Tighten hex flanged head bolt and hex flanged lock nut to 100 to 120 Lbf-ft (136 to 163 N•m).

Position the other end of track bar rod (Item 9) into track bar mount of air suspension upper mounting plate (Item 13) and install hex flanged head bolt (Item 21) from the rear and install hex lock nut (Item 22). Tighten hex flanged head bolt and hex lock nut to 100 to 120 Lbf-ft (136 to 163 N•m).

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Ride Valve
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 107 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Position cab air ride valve (Item 2) in place on track bar mount bracket (Item 9) and install two hex head bolts (Item 10) with two flat washers (Item 11) thru cab air ride valve and track bar mount bracket and install two hex lock nuts (Item 12). Tighten to 8 to 10 Lbf-ft (11 to 14 N•m).

Push push to connect elbow fitting (Item 8) into bottom of cab air ride valve (Item 2). Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push air line (supply) (Item 1) into push to connect elbow fitting (Item 8) of cab air ride valve (Item 2). Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.
Turn valve so dot (mark) on face of rotating selector is in the down position (Figure 164) .

figure.caption: Figure 164. Location of Mark on Valve Adjuster Face

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. SHOWS LOCATION OF MARK (DOT) OR ARROW ON VALVE ADJUSTER FACE. MARK MUST FACE IN THE DOWN POSITION.

step1.para: Install vertical adjuster rod (Item 5) into nyliner bushing (Item 6) and bracket (Item 7). Install flat washer (Item 4) over end of vertical adjuster rod and install cotter pin (Item 3) thru vertical adjuster rod.
Build up air pressure and check for air leaks.

Check cab ride height between bottom of air suspension upper mounting plate to top of crossmember the air suspension lower mounting plate is mounted on. Cab air suspension ride height is 7 3/4 inches (196.9 mm) (Figure 168) . If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS,
CAB AIR RIDE SYSTEM FOR 9200 i /9400 i /9900 i DAY CAB MODELS WITHOUT DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES BEFORE DECEMBER 2001
.
